articles.title: Argentina president announces new debt deal with IMF
articles.description: Argentine President Alberto Fernandez unveiled what he called a "reasonable" new debt repayment deal with the International Monetary Fund on Friday, the day a $700-million repayment was due.
articles.content:

articles.title: IMF's Gopinath says Argentina to cut primary fiscal deficit to zero by 2025
articles.description: Read more about IMF's Gopinath says Argentina to cut primary fiscal deficit to zero by 2025 on Devdiscourse
articles.content:
The fiscal path agreed by Argentina and the International Monetary Fund calls for reducing the country's primary budget deficit to zero by 2025, IMF First Deputy Managing Director Gita Gopinath said on Friday.

articles.title: Argentina, IMF Agree to Restructure $44 Billion Bailout
articles.description: Latin America’s third-biggest economy seeks to avoid a currency crisis and another debt default with a deal to gradually reduce public spending and money printing.
articles.content: Argentine President Alberto Fernández said Friday that his government reached a deal with the International Monetary Fund to restructure a $44 billion bailout that would help the South American country avert a debt default and currency meltdown after... [319 chars]

articles.title: Argentina strikes breakthrough deal with IMF in $40 bln debt talks
articles.description: Argentina has struck a deal for a $44.5 billion standby agreement with the International Monetary Fund (IMF), the government said on Friday, a major breakthrough in tense and lengthy talks to restructure loans the country cannot repay.

articles.title: FIFA WC qualifiers 2022: Ecuador draw Brazil; Argentina sink Chile
articles.description: Ecuador is one win away from returning to the World Cup after a 1-1 home draw with South American qualifying leader Brazil on Thursday. Coach Gustavo Alfaro's team will qualify to play in Qatar if it beats Peru next week.
articles.content:
Follow us on Image Source : SANTIAGO ARCOS/POOL VIA AP Ecuador's Felix Torres (second from left) heads the ball to score his side's first goal against Brazil during FIFA World Cup 2022 qualifier at Casa Blanca stadium In Quito on Thursday.

articles.title: FIFA World Cup Qualifiers: Ecuador draws Brazil; Argentina sinks Chile sans Covid-affected Lionel Messi
articles.description: Lionel Messi is recovering from COVID-19 and did not play. But the veteran di Maria was on fire during the first half. He scored the opening goal in the ninth minute with a rocket from the edge of the box, making the Chileans even more tense about missing out on Qatar.
